description: From Latin tolerātus (past participle), from tolerō (“I endure”). Cognate with Old English þolian (“to tolerate, suffer, bear”). More at thole.

verbs.description: tolerate (third-person singular simple present tolerates, present participle tolerating, simple past and past participle tolerated)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To allow or permit without explicit approval, usually if it is perceived as negative.
examples: The party tolerated corruption within its ranks.
Synonyms: live with, put up with
I can tolerate working on Saturday, but not Sunday.
The elevator can tolerate up to 360 kilograms.
